meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: WHERE EVERYTHING LIVES HAPPILY EVER AFTER

div.a: Step Inside The Real Disney Vault

div.div: In a non-descript building, in a hidden location, lies the Disney Animation Research Library. Imagine, if you will, a repository where animators can visit and research every note scribbled napkin or original art cel created by a Disney artist.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QzUdu4&via=Digg&text=Step Inside The Real Disney Vault

div.a: iPhone Case Deflects .50 Caliber Bullet On Video

div.div: A bulletproof iPhone case that claims to protect against .50 caliber sniper rifle bullets gets put to the test on film.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PMxdbS&via=Digg&text=iPhone Case Deflects .50 Caliber Bullet On Video

div.div: Several big-budget films have stuck to their practical effects-loving guns and have dodged the CGI monster at every turn.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PJPR4a&via=Digg&text=10 Films Surprisingly Created Without CGI

div.div: Lee Boyd Malvo said he remembers each of the sniper shootings in detail. But one moment — one image — stands out among the carnage of that terrifying time 10 years ago: “Mr. Franklin’s eyes.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QDmun3&via=Digg&text='I Was A Monster'

div.a: Meet Some Of The World's Shortest Domain Names

div.div: There are 676 websites that have two-letter, dot-com domain names. Here's what they are.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Psnhmk&via=Digg&text=Meet Some Of The World's Shortest Domain Names

div.a: David Blaine Is Letting You Shock Him With 1 Million Volts Of Electricity For 72 Hours

div.div: David Blaine's next performance, which will be open to the public free of charge in Manhattan starting Friday evening, features a novel bit of torture: for the first time, his audience will be doling out punishment.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SwNAZI&via=Digg&text=David Blaine Is Letting You Shock Him With 1 Million Volts Of Electricity For 72 Hours

div.a: The One Thing Apple Maps Is Better Than Google Maps At

div.div: Side by side, Google Maps is better than Apple Maps. No matter what anybody says, that's the truth. But unbeknownst to most people, there's actually something that Apple Maps is better at and it's pretty damn important: Apple Maps is a lot more data efficient, nearly five times more data efficient than Google Maps.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R8u2vm&via=Digg&text=The One Thing Apple Maps Is Better Than Google Maps At

div.div: Using LEGO and pure genius, YouTuber XXxOPRIMExXX created this amazing stop-motion homage to the great Stanley Kubrick film Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb.

li.div: Dr. Strangelove, remade entirely in Lego. The world is now complete. boingboing.net/2012/10/01/lego...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SUB4bt&via=Digg&text=LEGO Dr. Strangelove

div.a: Serious Racism Allegations Leveled At Gaming Startup

div.div: A San Francisco gaming startup is at the centre of some pretty serious allegations of institutional racism, after a person claiming to be an employee wrote a lengthy blog post outlining repeated acts of discrimination against he and other black colleagues.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PVkpRm&via=Digg&text=Serious Racism Allegations Leveled At Gaming Startup

div.a: Rapper Stomps On Laptops While Playing At A Microsoft Store

div.div: Upcoming American rapper Machine Gun Kelly (MGK) was hired to perform at Microsoft's Atlanta retail store on Friday, but the software giant got more than it bargained for.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OAERKt&via=Digg&text=Rapper Stomps On Laptops While Playing At A Microsoft Store

div.div: Ukrainianiphone.com reports to have obtained parts for the upcoming iPad mini.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SAcvvd&via=Digg&text=Leaked iPad Mini Photos

div.a: 'The Art Of Video Games' To Tour Across U.S.

div.div: 'The Art of Video Games' will spend the next four years on a cross-country road trip, landing in Seattle, Phoenix, Toledo, Norfolk, and Memphis, among other locations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OBfwjF&via=Digg&text='The Art Of Video Games' To Tour Across U.S.

div.a: Newscaster Responds On Air To Insulting 'Obese' Email

div.div: A La Crosse, WI news anchor goes on air to respond to criticisms about her weight.

li.div: This is the best thing I've seen in a long time: A news anchor in La Crosse, WI responds on air to a fat shaming email video.news8000.com/watch.php?i...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SA0IMV&via=Digg&text=Newscaster Responds On Air To Insulting 'Obese' Email

div.a: The Steve Jobs Stories You Haven't Heard

div.div: There are plenty of “Steve” stories that you haven’t heard around, and a year after Jobs’ death on Oct. 5 at the age of 56, a few friends and colleagues shared their memories of the technology industry’s most notable luminary.

li.div: Steve Jobs once made Bill Gates wait for an hour before a meeting at NeXT just for the heck of it forbes.com/sites/conniegug...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P8bteB&via=Digg&text=The Steve Jobs Stories You Haven't Heard

div.div: While visiting Korea in September, Google Chairman Eric Schmidt learned to dance Gangnam Style with pop star Psy at the company’s Seoul office.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UCHHv7&via=Digg&text=Eric Schmidt, Gangnam Master

div.a: Jerry Seinfeld Rips The New York Times Apart In A Letter To The Editor

div.div: "Your Critic’s Notebook column about the overuse of the term “Really?” was so deeply vacuous that I couldn’t help but feel that you have stepped into my area of expertise."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QGHysz&via=Digg&text=Jerry Seinfeld Rips The New York Times Apart In A Letter To The Editor

div.a: A Stunning Map Of How Foreclosures Ate America

div.div: We've all heard that the housing bubble's pop led to thousands of foreclosures, but it's interactives like this from WNYC that really show how prevalent the problem was—and still is.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QVDrGn&via=Digg&text=A Stunning Map Of How Foreclosures Ate America

div.a: You Might Be A Terrorist If You Use 'Social Networks'

div.div: These are some warning signs that that you have turned into a terrorist who will soon kill your co-workers, according to the U.S. military.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OANh4s&via=Digg&text=You Might Be A Terrorist If You Use 'Social Networks'

div.a: Zuckerberg Confirms: 'I Wear The Same Thing Every Day'

div.div: "I mean, I wear the same thing every day, right? I mean, it's literally, if you could see my closet."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WfOtK0&via=Digg&text=Zuckerberg Confirms: 'I Wear The Same Thing Every Day'

div.a: Weather Channel Has Gone Full-Geek With 2012 Winter Storm Names

li.div: I hope we get ALL THE SNOW this winter because these are the BEST storm names, @weatherchannel! weather.com/news/winter-st...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QJS9TO&via=Digg&text=Weather Channel Has Gone Full-Geek With 2012 Winter Storm Names

div.a: Butch Cassidy's Gun Up For Auction

div.div: Cassidy, the infamous Old West bank robber, bought the revolver in a hardware store in Vernal, Utah, in 1896.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wf7NHr&via=Digg&text=Butch Cassidy's Gun Up For Auction

div.a: NYPD Increasing Facebook Presence To Fight Gangs

div.div: The New York Police Department is planning to double the size of its gang unit to 300 detectives to combat teen violence fueled by dares and insults traded on social media.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SzoN7d&via=Digg&text=NYPD Increasing Facebook Presence To Fight Gangs

div.a: Watch Pearl Jam Play At Tower Records In 1991

div.div: Here is Pearl Jam's entire set from November 14th, 1991 at a Tower Records (R.I.P.) in Yonkers, New York. It's almost depressing until you see Eddie Vedder's smile...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sw73x6&via=Digg&text=Watch Pearl Jam Play At Tower Records In 1991

div.a: If You Give A Store Your Email, It'll Find You On Facebook

div.div: Facebook admits it: retail chains can use hashed e-mails to find and target users.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QFk6fh&via=Digg&text=If You Give A Store Your Email, It'll Find You On Facebook
